thread.title: Perasol to step down after UAAP season
thread.title_full: Perasol to step down after UAAP season | mb.com.ph | Philippine News

author: Christian Jacinto
title: Perasol to step down after UAAP season
text:
by Christian Jacinto
October 11, 2015 There will be a new Ateneo coach next year – that’s for certain.
Blue Eagle coach Bo Perasol announced yesterday that he will step down at the end of the UAAP season, confirming early rumors that he was on the way out after a spate of losses suffered by Ateneo.
The last straw may have been Ateneo’s 66-61 loss to Far Eastern University yesterday.
“This is my final year. I already told them that this is going to be my last year, regardless (of what happens),” Perasol said.
But he said Ateneo’s current woes had nothing to do with his impending departure.
“Alam nila lahat yan this is my last year. My team knows that, my players know that, kaya this is our last hurrah together, with Kiefer (Ravena) and Von (Pessumal).”
Pressure on Perasol had been mounting especially after Ateneo’s 80-76 loss to archrival La Salle last week.
Reports said that several backers were willing to make a midseason coaching change but Ateneo president Jett Villarin gave his full support to the former Air21 and Powerade mentor.
However, Perasol, whose three-year contract expires after the season, will leave regardless of the team’s fate.
